summary.en: an abbreviation most often meaning lumens (a measure of light output), or sometimes a personâ€™s initials

definition.en: the abbreviation for lumen(s), a unit used to measure the amount of visible light produced by a source

examples.en: This LED bulb outputs 800 lm, similar to a traditional 60-watt bulb.

definition.en: a common written abbreviation for a last name (or first name) initials, used in lists, forms, or informal notes

examples.en: Please ask LM to review the draft by Friday.
The package was signed for by LM.

summary.en: used online to show youâ€™re laughing a lot at something.

definition.en: an internet slang abbreviation meaning â€œlaughing my ass off,â€ used to show that you think something is very funny (often stronger than â€œLOLâ€).

summary.en: internet slang for laughing very hard

definition.en: an internet slang expression meaning â€œlaughing very hardâ€ (often used to show something is really funny, sometimes also used casually to soften a message)

examples.en: That video is so funny, lmao.
Lmao, I thought the meeting was tomorrow.
He said he can cook, but he burned waterâ€”lmao.

summary.en: internet slang for laughing extremely hard (often vulgar)

definition.en: an internet slang initialism meaning â€œlaughing my f***ing ass off,â€ used to show that something is extremely funny (often informal or vulgar)

examples.en: LMFAO, that video made my day.

summary.en: an abbreviation meaning either â€œlight machine gunâ€ or â€œlet me guess,â€ depending on context.

definition.en: an abbreviation for â€œlight machine gun,â€ a relatively portable automatic firearm used in military contexts (and commonly mentioned in games).

examples.en: In the game, the LMG has a large magazine but slower movement speed.
The squad carried an LMG to provide covering fire.

definition.en: an abbreviation for â€œlet me guess,â€ used online to introduce a prediction, often with a sarcastic or teasing tone.

examples.en: LMGâ€”you forgot your password again?
LMG, the meeting got moved to Friday.

summary.en: a platform for managing and tracking courses, learning, and training

definition.en: a software platform used to deliver, manage, and track teaching, learning materials, assignments, grades, and training (especially online)

examples.en: Our school uses an LMS to post homework and announcements.
Please submit your assignment through the LMS before midnight.
The company moved all training courses into a single LMS.

summary.en: a protocol for local/final email delivery

definition.en: Local Mail Transfer Protocol: a protocol used to deliver email from a mail server to a local message store (often to a mailbox server), similar to SMTP but typically used for final delivery within an organization.

examples.en: Our mail relay uses LMTP to deliver messages to the mailbox server.
LMTP is often chosen for local delivery because it can report per-recipient delivery results.
